Dadge says "good" but should say "Great"
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Dadge says "good" but should say "Great"
By Radagast the Brown on Tuesday, March 8, 2011 - 03:58 am:

So here's my problem... I'm breeding a Zuum/Gali (3/3/3/4/3/3) and Henger/Golem (2/4/3/3/3/3), trying to make an Omega: Henger/Zuum.

Zuum/Gali
Lif: 376 x 1 = 376
Pow: 610 x 1 = 610
Int: 534 x 1 = 534
Ski: 457 x 1.5 = 686
Spd: 688 x 1 = 688
Def: 416 x 1 = 416

That makes him Spd/Ski/Pow/Int/Def/Lif.

Henger/Golem
Lif: 284 x .5 = 124
Pow: 260 x 1.5 = 390
Int: 388 x 1 = 388
Ski: 392 x 1 = 392
Spd: 552 x 1 = 552
Def: 271 x 1 = 271

Which makes him Spd/Ski/Pow/Int/Def/Lif

Omega base stat order is also Spd/Ski/Pow/Int/Def/Lif, so I was really excited about something good coming out (I'm not ACTUALLY breeding yet, I still have years of life left in the Henger, I was just checking the outcome because these are my first 2 monsters, and my first ever combo).

Shouldn't Dadge call this "great"? He says its only "good" though!!!!

By Radagast the Brown on Tuesday, March 8, 2011 - 05:39 am:

Update: I trained the Henger/Golems def up to 286, which is just 2 higher than the uncorrected Lif value. This made Dadge say "great". Are the Henger/Golems stat gains possibly wrong? it seems like they are actually 3/4/3/3/3/3

By Elf* on Tuesday, March 8, 2011 - 09:19 am:

I'm facing something similar. I don't know if I just assume that it's correct as I've mindlessly
looked over it now more times than I care to count, but this theoretically should be a Great

levels, but based on the differences between them there should be no effect.

Hare/Tiger - Base stat order: Spd/Skl/Pow/Lif/Int/Def

By Radagast the Brown on Wednesday, March 9, 2011 - 01:50 am:

Further Update!!: So, my henger/golem appears to be in stage 6. His Domino (light str) gains between 10-13, and most of his other stat gains fall in line.

Two issues I've noticed:
1st (minorish): His Pull can still net him 20 str on success. From the Statgains, I thought it should only go between 18-19. I assume that the statgain numbers are actually something like 19-22, and actually gain just get caps to 20, which would solve this problem.

2nd (bigger issue)!!: His Endure (light def) drill gains between 5-8. That seems like gain stat of 2, not 3 as is listed for him. If his stat gains were, in fact 2/4/3/3/3/2, that would answer what caused my first issue as well.

By Elf* on Tuesday, March 15, 2011 - 04:26 am:

Battle makes it lose 3 weeks + the 1 it'd lose anyway, so feeding an MB would only give it 3 weeks of
life out of the necessary 4.
